title: What is your all time favorite three-member band? - Quora

response.answer_text: Choosing a favorite is incredibly subjective. Three piece bands are pretty rare, and normally require outstanding musicians. By their nature, no member can hide behind the other members, and must actually carry a lot of responsibility. I’m not considering bands like The Who or Led Zepplin, where a fourth member primarily sang, because the question asked for a three member band. My first thought was Cream with Eric Clapton, Ginger Baker and Jack Bruce. But then I remember the impact that The Jimi Hendrix Experience has on me, with Mitch Mitchell and Noel Redding. But in the end my subjective favorite would be a band that no one is likely to agree with. The James Gang with Joe Walsh, Jimmy Fox and Dale Peters. This was Joe Walsh at his absolute best on guitar. They were a power trio capable of acoustic songs and on occasion Joe switched to keyboards. Their second album, The James Gang Rides Again encompasses all of these styles. And it wasn’t just versatile in the recording studio. Live, Jimmy Fox would go from drums to bass guitar, while Dale Peters went from bass to joining Joe on acoustic guitar. The first three studio albums from 1969 to 1971 are well worth a listen.

That would have to be, without a doubt, Nomeansno. Part of me wants to say Trio. They are certainly an honorable mention. I’m sure I could find a few others, if I set my mind to it. But end of day, you asked for one band and if I can only choose one, it has to be Nomeansno.  Of course, I was a child when that came out. I was fairly a child when they released this album. However, I feel like it was my first introduction to the band (it was a long time ago, so I can’t be sure. My memory isn’t what it used to be.)  My fondness for the band is in no small part due for their penchant towards amateur existentialism in their lyrics but… honestly, their drummer is just freaking awesome. By the time I was old enough to see them (they’re a Canadian punk band, so around these parts, they only played bars) they had gone from a 3 person band to a 2 person band (in studio) and finally a 4 person band, but that last bit was only because the drummer had been layering the drum tracks and they needed 2 drummers for some of the songs. Having lost one of their original members, the (main) drummer would occasionally step out from behind his drum kit to do vocals. Here’s a clip from the two-drummer era…  But for the majority of their career, they were a 3 person band. 8 )

Mine would have to be Moderat, which is actually a superband formed in 2002 by a duo known as Modeselektor, active since 1996, and a solo artist known as Apparat, also active since 1996. All of them are part of the Berlin electro scene. However, while Apparat’s music is melodic, bright, faint and full of longing (he sings, has explained being “more interested in designing sounds than beats”, and has included more and more classical instruments in his compositions over the years), Modeselektor’s is very rhythmic, high-powered, self-confident and wicked (nasty bass, techno beats, major chords, R&B influences, occasional collaborations with rap and rock artists). They complement each other really well; it feels like you have both your head in the clouds and your feet solidly anchored in the ground. Who needs drugs when you have music like that? Because the two entities both have released music before coming together, you are able to appreciate what comes from each part of this union, which makes it all the more interesting. Finally, they usually have amazing light design and visuals on their live performances. Moderat live in Berlin (2016):  Modeselektor alone (with a featuring) (2011):  Apparat alone (2011):  Moderat as a superband is currently on a hiatus to pursue separate projects but it’s very possible they come back together someday. Apart from that, I do hope that Depeche Mode, Muse, Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, Mercury Rev, Leftfield, N*E*R*D, Nirvana, Two Door Cinema Club, Die Antwoord, The xx and Major Lazer make appearances here and there in other people’s answers :-)

A 3 piece band that meant a lot to me was/is Raven. These guys were in the NWOBHM and still make music today. Back in the mid 80s I was listening to punk( I loved the energy and the lyrics) and I had always listened to rock and metal. Raven was the band that sort of bridged the gap between the two for me. I picked up the Crash,Bang,Wallop ep and it really changed my world. They were heavy and were great musicians, but were really raw and full of energy. I had also heard a song by them called Seek and Destroy off the All for One album that just floored me. They weren’t thrash, but could certainly be called the precursor of. These guys were nuts and I loved it. A great band that still plays today, check em out.

CREAM, the British 1960s band compiled of Eric Clapton, Ginger Baker and Jack Bruce. Three guys who had put in their time and logged up so many hours in music that when they first met they jammed for hours and knew it was the right chemistry to create some amazing music. In my view Cream was Eric Clapton’s heyday. Jack Bruce's bass and voice fit perfectly into their sound along with Ginger Baker’s drumming. A threesome rock band stripped down to the bare essentials and all masters of their craft. Every one of their albums hit the spot, likewise their singles, ‘Badge’, ‘Sunshine of Your Love’ to name a couple plus some cameos like ‘ Pressed Rat and Warthog', Tales of Brave Ulysses, Politician And ‘I Feel Free.‘ Many punters vote ‘ ‘Disraeli Gears' as their finest album and it is a poweful presentation of what Rock was like before Led Zepplin. For a taste check out their version of ‘Crossroads' from the ‘Cream Farewell Concert' movie.

Primus. Mostly Les, Ler and Jay. But the real weird brilliance is mostly captured with Herb playing drums as he is in a march band. Honorable mentions to Police, beastie boys, zz top, muse and Cream.(only a single fan of Rush , JH exp and motorhead). My favorite all time album is King Crimsons “Red”, when they were just three.

Rush is without doubt my favorite trio. Fifty years of phenominal progessive music produced by three of the most talented musicians is why. A close second would be King's X for all the same reasons. While they have only been around for 30 years they have the upside of adding exceptional three part vocal harmonies which are beyond reproach. Both bands make fantastic albums but have the ability to back it up live. I've seen both bands on many occasions and have never walked away disappointed.

For me it has to be our friends from the north. RUSH. I was 14 at the time and couldn't believe that just three guys were making all that sound. A buddy of mine up the street bought “All the Worlds a Stage” and didn't like it. So I took it off his hands for 5 bucks. I spent a lot of time jamming in the basement that summer.

Probably Cream. Although I can’t stand Ginger Baker, Jack Bruce and Eric Clapton more than made up for him. Hard to believe EC was only 23 when he was in this band. Their live version of Crossroads still one of the best live recordings ever. Honorable mention to ZZ Top, who are amazingly still together with the original lineup.

I really dug the Police,they were interesting.My favorite is Rush.Even when i’m in front of them,seeing them in concert,i cannot believe it’s just 3 guys.Cream really had an interesting thing going on,just to pull the plug.

Cream, ELP or the Police. I am choosing these three because they had a solid live act, with good singing and very accomplished musicians on each instrument. They were unique in their time, probably with many imitators. Jimi Hendrix for me is lower down the list because his singing was not that good.

That must be Grand Funk Railroad until Phoenix, when Craig Frost joined. They still were one of my all time faves - but not a three man band anymore. ZZ Top comes in second and Budgie is ranked third.

Experience or Cream, but that is on record. Live I would take Cream. I didn’t really care much for Hendrix live. He was all over the place and incoherent in his playing. Could have been the drugs, but still I was disappointed.
ZZ Top.
ZZ Top
That’s Rush for me! I also like Triumph, Cream, Grand Funk Railroad, Dust, The Jimi Hendrix Experience, Coroner, Sir Lord Baltimore, and a number of others. But Rush is my favourite of all time!
Cream I suppose. Because Hendrix IMO was more a soloist with a rhythm section. I loved Robin Trower's band when he left Procol Harum too.
“Los Panchos” Los Panchos - Wikipedia  Do you mean rock? “Soda Stereo” Soda Stereo - Wikipedia
Jimi Hendrix Experience. Because.. well Jimi Hendrix!)) Then Rush. These guys never disappoint. Great albums that make you think. A thinking man's metal band. And live shows just phenomenal.
Green Day. Changed my life the first time I listened to American Idiot whole.
Probably HENDRIX EXPERIENCe buy also The Jam
Cream would by my first thought, but since I have the opportunity to promote my old fav here: Budgie.
Wow. That’s a good question. First band that pops into my mind is ZZTop. But then there is Grand Funk Railroad and Crosby, Stills, and Nash. I think I will stick with ZZ Top.
THE POLICE!
I WOULD CHOOSE JIMI HENDRIX AND HIS 2 COHORTS IN CRIME!
The Jam
ZZ Top
Rush.

Stevie Ray Vaughn and Double Trouble Make no mistake, it was more than just a Stevie Ray show. Tommy Shannon and Chris “Whipper”Layton were a BIG part of the sound. With a lesser rhythm section, Stevie would not have sounded the same.
Cream, the 1st power trio (Eric Clapton, Jack Bruce, Ginger Baker) Beck, Bogert, Appice (Jeff Beck, Tim Bogert, Carmen Appice)
Australia's X
Definitely Rush:  The Jam would be my number 2 pick:  Nirvana is a good contender:  James Gang:  And if you don’t know The Jimi Hendrix Experience, well feast on this:  You are welcome!
Rush at top of list with Triumph right behind of course there’s ZZ Top, Cream, The Police and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs.
Grand Funk Railroad (before adding the 4th)
1.Rush 2.The Jam 3.Cream. Cheers!
Z Z top I just love them and I am not even sure why
Presidents of United States of America
Jimi Hendrix Experience!
3 Dog Night t
